title: strange effect in app activation: doubled apps
body:
i observe an annoying effect in the apps adminstration: 

when openening the apps section of the administration a list of all known apps is shown, installed and not installed ones. amongst those is the 'imprint' app. when successfully activating that app, regarless of whether it is locally installed or downloaded from apps.owncloud.com upon activation, the app suppendly appears _twice_ inside the list of apps. the new entry has a capital first letter ("imprint") and is marked as 'enabled', the old entry (bottom of the list) does not have a capital first letter ("imprint") and stays marked as not enabled. 
aparently owncloud collects the list of apps from different information sources. i guess the source of the issue is that i (probably) acidentially registered the app at apps.owncloud.com without a capital first letter, whilst the appinfo/info.xml description names the app with a capital letter. aparently owncloud fails to identify the two versions as being one single app. it might well be that this issue only arises on non-ms-windows installations, since ms-windows is blind towards cases in file names afaik. 

although the two variants in naming might be the source of the issue, i still consider this an obvious bug in the owncloud app installer. i guess the motivation of the two different information sources is availability at different points in time. however an additional check might make sense which makes sure that such pairs are identified and handled. 

ps: maybe someone with the required rights to the apps.owncloud.com system could fix the naming of the registered app from "imprint" to "imprint"? that would at least remove the confusing effect for all installations.
